title: Michael Avenatti sentenced to 14 years in prison for stealing millions of dollars from clients
description: Disgraced attorney Michael Avenatti was sentenced Monday to 14 years in prison for embezzling millions of dollars from four of his clients and obstruction.

title: Brazil advances to quarterfinals with dazzling display against South Korea
description:
• Goalkeeper's shootout heroics lift Croatia
• England star leaves World Cup after intruders break into family home

title: This AI chatbot is dominating social media with its frighteningly good essays
description: Imagine if Siri could write you a college essay, or Alexa could spit out a movie review in the style of Shakespeare.

title: Why some Russians have vowed to resist Putin's invasion
description: A soldier in a Ukrainian uniform morosely contemplates the ruins of an Orthodox monastery in Ukraine's eastern Donetsk region.

title: 'I just have to kill them': Russian describes fighting homeland
description: CNN's Sam Kiley speaks with members of Ukraine's Russian Legion, comprised of Russian defectors and volunteers who fled their country to protect Ukraine, about defending the city of Bakhmut and their hopes for Russia's future.

title: Wearing hearing aids may lower your risk for cognitive decline and dementia, study finds
description: Hearing aids might be an important tool in the effort to prevent cognitive decline and dementia, according to a new study.

title: Is this the end for Iran's notorious morality police?
description: An Iranian official's comment signaling that the country's notorious morality police had been shut down has raised more questions than answers.

title: NASA's Orion capsule makes farewell flyby of the moon
description: The historic Artemis I mission, which is sending an uncrewed spacecraft on an unprecedented trip around the moon, is now in the final stretch of its historic journey.

title: Putin visits key Crimea bridge damaged by huge explosion in October
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has made a visit to the Kerch Bridge, a key link between the annexed Crimean peninsula and mainland Russia which was partially destroyed by an explosion in October, according to Russian state media.

title: How Elon Musk went from liberal to conservative hero
description: CNN's Harry Enten discusses a new NBC News poll that shows Republicans have warmed up to Elon Musk since he purchased Twitter.

title: China's Xi to visit Saudi Arabia, sources say, amid frayed ties with the US
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping is set to arrive in Saudi Arabia on Thursday for a two-day state visit amid high tensions between the United States and the two countries, according to a source with knowledge of the trip, an Arab diplomatic source and a senior Arab official.

title: Putin signs expanded anti-LGBTQ laws in Russia, in latest crackdown on rights
'Goblin mode' chosen as Oxford word of the year for 2022
description: As you read this, look around. Are you still in bed? Are there piles of clothes and takeout food boxes strewn across the floor? Do you have chip crumbs on your sheets? Have you broken your self-care routine more times than you can count? Do you not even care? If so, you might already be in "goblin mode" -- chosen by the public as the 2022 Oxford word of the year.

title: Ultraprocessed food may contribute to dementia, but you can stop the decline, study says
description: We all eat them — ultraprocessed foods such as frozen pizza and ready-to-eat meals make our busy lives much easier. Besides, they are just darn tasty — who isn't susceptible to hot dogs, sausages, burgers, french fries, sodas, cookies, cakes, candy, doughnuts and ice cream, to name just a few?

title: Putin signs expanded anti-LGBTQ laws in Russia, in latest crackdown on rights
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has signed into law a bill banning so-called LGBTQ "propaganda" in Russia, in the latest crackdown on human rights in the country.

title: At least one person in Kryvyi Rih, and at least two in Zaporizhzhia, dead in fresh strikes
description: Russian forces unleashed a new round of missiles towards Ukraine on Monday, ramping up attacks on the central and southeastern regions of the country.

title: Neil Diamond surprises audience with 'Sweet Caroline' performance at Broadway opening of 'A Beautiful Noise'
description: Neil Diamond sang "Sweet Caroline" at the Broadway opening of his musical" A Beautiful Noise," five years after retiring due to his Parkinson's diagnosis.

title: The clean energy company turning city blocks greener
description: BlocPower, a Brooklyn-based clean energy company, is bringing eco-friendly, all-electric heating and cooling systems to older buildings in lower income communities, with the goal of reducing carbon footprints and energy bills.

title: Famed tennis coach who taught Williams sisters, Andre Agassi and Maria Sharapova dies aged 91
description: Nick Bollettieri, the famed tennis coach who taught the likes of the Williams sisters, Andre Agassi and Maria Sharapova, has died aged 91.

title: Japan hopes to recreate group stage magic as it takes on Croatia
Axl Rose will stop tossing mic after a fan was reportedly injured
description: Axl Rose is ending a 30-year Guns N' Roses tradition.

title: 'Harry & Meghan' series gets release date and new trailer
description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have an early Christmas gift for their supporters.

title: Pfizer/BioNTech seek FDA authorization of updated Covid-19 vaccine for children under 5
description: Pfizer and BioNTech have submitted an application to the US Food and Drug Administration for their updated Covid-19 vaccine to be used as the third shot in the three-dose primary vaccine series for children ages 6 months through 4 years.

title: Sky-high Black turnout fueled Warnock's previous win. Will Georgia do it again?
description: Former UN Ambassador Andrew Young rode his scooter alongside Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock, Martin Luther King III and a fervent crowd of marchers on a recent Sunday through a southwest Atlanta neighborhood. The group stopped at an early polling location to vote, forming a line with some waiting as long as one hour to cast their ballots.

title: Flight heading to UK diverted after 'possible' bomb reported on board
description: An EasyJet flight bound for the UK from Poland had to be diverted to the Czech Republic on Sunday due to a report of a "possible bomb" on board.

title: The West just scrambled the oil market. What happens next is up to Russia
description: Most Russian crude oil exports to Europe are now banned, marking the boldest effort yet by the West to pile financial pressure on President Vladimir Putin as his brutal war in Ukraine enters its tenth month.

title: Elon Musk's Twitter is helping to normalize a neo-Nazi
description: Elon Musk apparently is trying his hand at creating a major media story by the release of what he called the "Twitter Files," which included internal Twitter documents from October 2020 showing the social media company's executives debating whether to allow postings on the platform of a New York Post article about a laptop Hunter Biden reportedly owned.

title: Jay Powell's dream of the 90s is dead
description: The US economy gained 263,000 jobs in November, 63,000 above the consensus estimate. The larger surprise was that average hourly earnings rose by 0.55%, the fastest pace since January.

title: Former Fort Worth police officer stands trial in the 2019 killing of Atatiana Jefferson
description: The murder trial of a former Fort Worth police officer who fatally shot Atatiana Jefferson in front of her young nephew in her Texas home in 2019 begins on Monday.

title: Rudy Giuliani: Ethics charges for election fraud claims take major step forward with trial-like hearing in DC
description: The efforts to discipline attorneys who aided former President Donald Trump's legal gambits to undermine the 2020 election take a major step forward Monday with the start of key disciplinary proceedings in Washington, DC, that will look into whether Rudy Giuliani violated attorney ethics rules.

title: Deshaun Watson struggles on return to NFL action after 11-game suspension following sexual misconduct allegations
description: Deshaun Watson struggled on his return to NFL action on Sunday after serving an 11-game suspension following sexual misconduct allegations.

title: Second gentleman Doug Emhoff to convene antisemitism summit at the White House this week
description: Second gentleman Doug Emhoff -- the first Jewish person in his position -- will convene an antisemitism summit Wednesday at the White House, Emhoff's office tells CNN.

title: Video shows shocking scene as dead seals wash ashore in Russia
description: At least 2,500 endangered seals have been found dead on the coast of the Caspian Sea in Russia, according to state media.

title: More than two dozen Taylor Swift fans sue Ticketmaster
description: Don't mess with Swifties.

title: He sat down on a bench at the airport. Then his future husband sat down next to him
description: James Sanford was sitting on a bench at Punta Cana International Airport in the Dominican Republic, waiting for his bag to appear on the luggage carousel.

title: Like fast fashion, 'fast furniture' is a problem for our planet
description: Russian designer Harry Nuriev's latest sofa is made from a pile of trash bags. Recently on show at the collectible design fair Design Miami, the Trash Bag Sofa was inspired by garbage on the streets of New York, and Nuriev wants it to draw attention to how we use and waste things.

title: Demand for hospital-grade cribs on the rise as viral illnesses continue to surge
description: As a trio of respiratory viruses spreads across the country and pediatric hospitalizations remain high, some hospitals are running into a new problem: a shortage of medical-grade cribs.

title: NFL Week 13: Ravens do it without Jackson, Burrow and Prescott put in dominant performances but Eagles stay top
description: Lamar Jackson suffered a first-quarter knee injury as the Baltimore Ravens (8-4) scraped a 10-9 win against the Denver Broncos (3-9) to stay top of AFC North.

title: Belgium's biggest ever trial begins over Brussels bombings
description: Belgium began proceedings on Monday in its largest ever trial to determine whether 10 men played a part in the Islamist suicide bombings in Brussels in 2016 that killed 32 people and injured over 300.

title: England star leaves World Cup after intruders break into family home
description: England soccer star Raheem Sterling is returning home from the World Cup in Qatar after armed intruders broke into his home while his family were inside, a person with knowledge of the situation told CNN.

title: UK recession could turn into a 'lost decade'
description: The United Kingdom faces a "lost decade" of growth if action isn't taken to address slumping business investment and worker shortages, a leading business lobby group has warned.

title: Foxconn says it's restoring production at the world's largest iPhone factory
description: Apple supplier Foxconn says it is "gradually" restoring production capacity at its sprawling campus in central China, which has been hit by Covid-19 restrictions and worker protests since October.

title: Why Italy's best restaurant has embraced vegetarianism
description: It's been named Italy's best restaurant, but if its customers think that means they'll be served upscale versions of the country's classic meat and fish dishes, they're in for a surprise.

title: More than 30,000 without power in North Carolina
description: Power outages that left around 40,000 customers in the dark Saturday night in North Carolina and prompted an emergency declaration are the subject of a criminal investigation after crews found evidence that substations were "intentionally" damaged by gunfire, authorities said.

title: Japan vs. Croatia: Samurai Blue aiming to reach World Cup quarterfinals for first time
Kylian Mbappé continues record-setting pace in France's World Cup round of 16 victory
description: It was a successful afternoon all-round for France on Sunday.

title: Another OPEC? Indonesia hopes for a cartel for battery metals
description: Indonesia produces more nickel than any other country. As demand soars for batteries to power the energy transition, that presents a huge opportunity, and the archipelago nation of 276 million people intends to take advantage of it.

title: Protesters win a partial victory as Chinese cities start to loosen Covid controls
description: • China's overseas police networks grow with help of some host nations: report

title: Protesters win a partial victory as Chinese cities start to loosen Covid controls
Trump's call to terminate the Constitution is a fantasy, but it's still dangerous
Russian strikes kill at least 1 person in central Ukraine
The latest on Russia's war in Ukraine
Lost remains of last Tasmanian tiger found hiding in plain sight
description: For decades, nobody knew where the remains of the last thylacine, or Tasmanian tiger, were located.

title: Morgan Stanley upgrades China stocks as global investors cheer on Covid reopening hopes
description: Global traders are increasingly feeling more bullish on China, as they bet the country will gradually unwind Covid restrictions following widespread protests.

title: Video captures explosive eruption of volcano in Indonesia
description: An eruption on Indonesia's Mount Semeru blanketed roads and homes in volcanic ash and prompted evacuations of nearly 2,000 residents in East Java province, according to authorities in the country. CNN's Allison Chinchar has more.

title: With winter coming, war isn't the only thing Ukrainians have to worry about
description: CNN's Will Ripley reports from Bucha, Ukraine, where many residents are bracing for a winter without power while they recover from Russian bombardment.

title: Analysis: Trump's call to terminate the Constitution is a fantasy, but still dangerous
description: Donald Trump's call for the termination of the Constitution is his most extreme anti-democratic statement yet and seems oblivious to the sentiments of voters who rejected election deniers in the midterm elections.

title: Meet the service dogs who can switch on lights and open doors
description: Since 1975, Canine Companions has placed 7,200 dogs with needy participants -- all free of charge. Dogs are trained for over two years to learn more than 40 commands that help better peoples' lives. For Izzy Sherman, a ten-year-old using a walker, her new service dog will be a "game changer."

title: Bob McGrath, original 'Sesame Street' cast member, dead at 90
description: Bob McGrath, an original cast member of the beloved children's program "Sesame Street," has died, according to statements from his family and Sesame Workshop shared on social media.

title: Japan vs. Croatia: Samurai Blue aiming to reach World Cup quarterfinals for first time
description: In a World Cup of surprises, Japan has played a leading role in headline-making shock results.

title: This country's relationship with Russia is causing concern in Ukraine
description: Retired Air Force Col. Cedric Leighton breaks down the potential Russian strategy in regards to the city of Bakhmut, Ukraine.
